note_text: OPERATIVE NARRATIVE: The patient presented with symptomatic post-tracheostomy sequelae. Upon bronchoscopic evaluation, circumferential mid-tracheal granulation tissue was identified, compromising the airway lumen. A strictly mechanical approach was adopted; the tissue was systematically excised utilizing biopsy forceps for piecemeal debridement and a snare for pedunculated elements. No thermal ablative modalities were employed. Hemostasis was achieved via cold saline lavage.

note_text: The patient arrived for elective bronchoscopy to address chronic cough related to tracheal granulation. Under moderate sedation, we advanced the bronchoscope and visualized the mid-tracheal stenosis. We proceeded to remove the granulation tissue mechanically. note_text:
PROCEDURE: Flexible bronchoscopy with mechanical excision of endobronchial neoplasm.
CLINICAL CONTEXT: Patient with persistent RUL atelectasis.
FINDINGS: A polypoid lesion was visualized occluding the right upper lobe orifice. 
INTERVENTION: Using a therapeutic flexible bronchoscope, the lesion was resected using a combination of biopsy forceps and electrosurgical snare (mechanical cutting). The tumor was removed in piecemeal fashion until the lobar orifice was patent. No vaporizing or coagulating ablation was performed.

note_text:
Procedure: Emergency Rigid Bronch
Patient: Steven Park
Steps:
1. GA. Rigid scope inserted.
2. Distal trachea almost closed off.
3. Cored through with scope.

5. Pulled out pieces with forceps.
6. Sats dropped but came back up.
Plan: ICU intubated.

note_text: Mr. Park was in critical condition with a tumor nearly closing off his windpipe. We performed an emergency rigid bronchoscopy. We used the metal tube of the scope to mechanically core a path through the tumor. We then used a shaving tool called a microdebrider to widen the opening further. We successfully restored the airway without using laser or heat, though his oxygen levels dipped briefly during the procedure.

note_text: Isabel Ramos has a tumor in the bronchus intermedius causing cough. Taking her for rigid bronch. Mass was polypoid blocking 80 percent. We cored it out and grabbed the pieces. Just mechanical stuff no balloon or heat. Bleeding was mild. She is going to the floor.

note_text: Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of BI tumor. Obstruction of bronchus intermedius from endobronchial tumor. Polypoid mass in bronchus intermedius with 80% obstruction. Rigid coring and forceps debulking used to mechanically debulk and excise tumor. Tumor removed in piecemeal fashion. No thermal ablation or balloon used. Extubated and discharged to floor.

BI obstruction, tumor.

General, Rigid.

80% stenosis. Mechanical excision via rigid coring and forceps. No ablation. Lumen 60% patent.
[Plan]
Overnight observation.

note_text: Ms. Ramos had a polyp-like tumor blocking her intermediate bronchus. We performed a rigid bronchoscopy to remove it. We used the sharp edge of the rigid scope to cut the tumor and forceps to remove it in pieces. We opened the airway to about 60% of its normal size without needing to use any burning tools.

note_text:
Procedure: Rigid endoscopy with physical resection of BI mass.
Findings: Polypoid growth obstructing the intermediate airway.
Intervention: The rigid instrument was used to shear the growth. Grasping tools were employed for extraction. No thermal devices were utilized.
Result: Partial restoration of airway caliber.
